result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Barksdale

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Barksdale in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court for Anthony Barksdale.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Calendar Call. Defendant appears. Court vacates the stayed warrant. 
Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. 
Case adjourned to Branch 13. 
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Anthony Barksdale not in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court for Anthony Barksdale.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Case set for pretrial conference.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 13.
Calendar call scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with MF
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Anthony Barksdale appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Elizabeth Holloway appeared by video for Anthony Barksdale.  Prosecuting attorney Sara Beth Hill appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Triggiano, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony Barksdale
Current: 4350 N 92nd St. #2, Milwaukee, WI 53222 United States  (Effective: 09-04-2022)
Prior: 2552 North 19th Street # Upper, Milwaukee, WI 53206
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
